results.title: The Urban migration
results.creator_credit: James Paul and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
This rather grim story in black and white of urbanisation versus nature uses cut-out and hand-drawn animation. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Paul and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT

results.title: Tree of us
results.creator_credit: Vilakone Phachanthavong and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Vilakone has created powerful graphics in this animated work about the family of the future through the use of a predominantly red background, with black and white hand-drawn images. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Under the influence
results.creator_credit: Fletcher Cheng and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
One wrong decision and your life can turn into hell. An intriguing computer animated moral tale of alcohol and addiction with a great soundtrack - music by Fletcher Cheng. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2004.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fletcher Cheng and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT

results.title: WCSC
results.brief_description:
Tune in as Jerry and Bruce commentate the sports event of the millennium! Rushkov versus Javichenko. Be sure to experience the giddying highs of Friday night WCSC live at Viagro Stadium.
Animated work. Includes animated nudity. Voices - Trent Baker, Simon Philamon. Written, directed and animated by Michael Hill.
results.description:

results.title: Opposites attract
results.creator_credit: Elin Bakken Tonder and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A shy retiring little man and his glamourous neighbour share meaningful looks as they pass each other in the hallway. He is entranced by her ravishing outfits, she is a little lonely and thinks ‘why not?’. But there is a twist in the tale of this claymation. Music by Matt Archer.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elin Bakken Tonder and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT

results.title: Karma
results.creator_credit: Shu Wang and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Stylish and artistic 3D animation explores the karmic implications of eating animals.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Skyfall
results.creator_credit: Robby Susanto, Lu Gao and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Great collaboration between a 2D and 3D animator to create a composite of cutout animation styles. A series of landscapes are degraded by human activities, in a dreamlike meditation on the despoilment of nature.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robby Susanto, Lu Gao and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.description:

results.title: Fluid
results.creator_credit: Lachlan Dean and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
An animated ink blot transverses the treacherous terrain contained within a sketchbook of ideas as scarey doodles attack it from every side.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: The Moment
results.creator_credit: Apid Busayasiri and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A young man goes to visit the grave of his grandmother at a remote graveyard on the outskirts of a city. While he is there a series of mysterious events unfold that magically transport him back to his joyful childhood. Hand drawn animation.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Apid Busayasiri and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
